alert.note: Alert for Chilton; Clay; Coosa; Shelby; St. Clair; Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 11:46PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Chilton, southwestern Talladega, Shelby, south central St. Clair, northwestern Coosa and southwestern Clay Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1145 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pell City to 6 miles southeast of Tannehill Ironworks State Park. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Alabaster, Pelham, Helena, Talladega, Sylacauga, Pell City, Calera, Chelsea, Montevallo, Childersburg, Columbiana, Jemison, Ashland, Wilsonville, Talladega Springs, Indian Springs Village, Vincent, Thorsby, Harpersville and Westover. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for central and east central Alabama.

area.areaDesc: Chilton; Clay; Coosa; Shelby; St. Clair; Talladega
